comment: I loved in the Italian course, how prof Lucchi would connect Italian back to Latin, as it is it's parent language. He is familiar with Latin as well. His lectures were always funny and insightful, and he'll understand if your attendance was lackluster due to work/other classes. He'll enhance your understanding in easy to remember ways.

He was so sweet and understanding that students have other classes and will extend due dates if you reach out to him. His material is so easy to understand and grasp if you just take the time to study. His quizzes are 5% and it's mostly about how you're progressing through the material; there are 3 main projects that make your grade and are great!
rating_tags: Amazing lectures --Clear grading criteria--Accessible outside class

comment: genuinely such a sweet man!! He doesn't give too much homework and is pretty funny. You can tell he cares about his students and what he's teaching. I would def recommend him for Italian 1001 :)
Lucchi is such a great character and will teach you lots of useful information about culture and what not.
Very nice guy that cares about his students. Do your work and pay attention and you'll be fine.

BEST class of my freshman year and best professor I've ever had! His teaching style made me fall in love with Latin, and his stories were absolutely hilarious! He makes the content applicable to real life and truly cares about the welfare of his students. Seriously, take him for your foreign language credit. He's a hidden gem of KSU!

Prof Lucchi is a super sweet and cute man. He is like a high school teacher in a way. His class is very easy and he is very understanding and lenient when it comes to turning things in late. He gives 3/4 test, a couple oral exams (which you can record or preform live),a final, and gives several opportunities for extra credit. I'm going to miss him.
easy italian class. he will make sure you pass. kind of like a high school teacher. take over anyone else

Alberto is such a nice professor and knows so much about Italy, as expected. He is very thoughtful and is a fair grader. Sometimes things can be unclear, but just ask him if you're confused abot something and he will happily clarify. I plan on taking him again.

Prof. Lucchi is the sweetest man. He had moments where it is hard to understand him or the point he was trying to make, but overall he was wonderful. Gives you till the end of the semester to turn in all homework, ample extra credit, and willing to help you with anything. There are tests and oral exams, so if you don't study thats where it shows.

So I think Fall 2014 might have been his first year teaching. He is a native Italian speaker, and he is very nice. He is also a very generous grader. He takes it very slow and is willing to work with you to make sure you learn the language. However, he will call on you multiple times in class, so you have to pay attention.
